Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

Volume_PDS3.archive_status_note: The database contains a value of NULL. For the purposes of this exercise, the value was replaced with IN_QUEUE
Volume_PDS3.volume_name: CHRONOLOGICAL DATA FOR COMET CROMMELIN AND COMET GIACOBINI-Z
Volume_PDS3.description:
A compilation of data for both Comet Crommelin and Comet Giacobini-Zinner, gathered by the IHW in its mission to provide a network of observers for collecting cometary data. The disc contains the archive of 695 observations of Comet Crommelin from 1983, Aug 9, through 1984, May 27. For Comet Giacobini-Zinner, the observations were collected to support the NASA spacecraft (ICE) as it passed through the tail of this comet on Sep 11, 1985. In the text file OBSCODES, the international network of observatories is listed. The collection represents 3764 observations obtained from 1984, January 28 through 1987, March 31. These data are part of the overall Comet Halley Archive produced by the IHW. This specific disc contains the original data, documentation, ephemeris, and other supplementary information for these two comets:
1. VOLDESC.SFD file which specifies the identification for the dataset contents of the Comet Crommelin and Comet Giacobini- Zinner Archives.
2. Compressed images for Comet Giacobini-Zinner and calibration data for both comets.
3. Detached labels for each data file in the PDS and FITS protocols for Comet Giacobini-Zinner; the original FITS files for Comet Crommelin are included.
4. Subsampled Browse images for fast access and selection of images for the detailed analysis of Comet Giacobini-Zinner.
5. An ephemeris of comet positions for Comet Giacobini-Zinner and Comet Crommelin.
6. Software which can be used to interpolate the comet position and decompress the full resolution images.
